intro: Chaenactis glabriuscula f. curta, commonly known as the short-stemmed plainsweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as plains and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are generally narrow and covered in fine, silky hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-green in color. This subspecies is distinguished by its shorter stem compared to the typical form of Chaenactis glabriuscula.
